questions.questionText: Which of the following is true about variable naming conventions in JavaScript?

options.text: ou should not use any of the JavaScript reserved keyword as variable name.
JavaScript variable names should not start with a numeral (0-9).

questions.explanation: Both of the option are correct

questions.questionText: Which of the following type of variable is visible everywhere in your JavaScript code?
questions.explanation: Global Variables: A global variable has global scope which means it is visible everywhere in your JavaScript code.

questions.questionText: Which built-in method returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value?
questions.explanation: indexOf() method returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not foundd

questions.questionText: Which built-in method reverses the order of the elements of an array?
questions.explanation: reverse() method reverses the order of the elements of an array -- the first becomes the last, and the last becomes the first.

questions.questionText: Which of the following function of Number object defines how many total digits to display of a number?
